answerText: Nuclear Magnetic Resonance spectroscopy[10] A typical solvent for NMR is an anesthetic which contains a carbon bonded to a deuterium and three atoms of this element. This halogen with atomic number 17 was also used as a chemical weapon in World War I.
heading: Illinois Fall Touranment |2012 | 5 | 16 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Tetramethylsilane is used as a standard for this technique, in which peak splitting occurs due to spin-spin coupling. For 10 points each: [10] Name this type of spectroscopy which uses a B-field and isotopes such as hydrogen-1 and carbon-13 to elucidate structures of molecules.
